channel.description:
[ul][center][IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/qzlsvc.jpg[/img][/center]
[center]Last updated @ [b]29/07/2012[/b][/center]
[size=36pt]DigiLife[/size]
[size=16pt]What is DigiLife?[/size] [center][IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/24xqux1.png[/img][/center] [center][size=8pt]DigiLife launch screen with placeholder background, more will come on the right hand side[/size][/center] DigiLife is a free, 2D top-down simulation game. It will feature an expandable world with customizable maps, NPCs, items and buildings and much much more. The game will take place in a pre-made city, the player is able to choose how to live his/her own life. Similar to that of a GTA style gameplay except with much wider opportunities such as building your own company, creating your own rockets etc.
The game will have 3 different ages, although players would be able to customize their ages in the future. Currently, there are Stone Age, Medieval Age and Modern Age planned. Development will focus on Stone Age first, then gradually move on to other ages.
The idea is that, in different ages, there are different styles of gameplay. From each age, people will have different skills they could master such as woodwork, metalwork, art, then gradually science, physics, astrophysics etc. The player is able to build whatever they want, start a clan, business or perhaps rule his/her people. Basically like a in-game virtual world.
[size=16pt]Official Website & Information[/size]
The game is Open Source and the official website is here: [url=http://digilifegame.com]http://digilifegame.com[/url] alongside with a game forums at [url=http://forums.digilifegame.com]http://forums.digilifegame.com[/url].
The game itself is still in a very early stage of development, but any updates and/or screenshots will be updated on the official website. The game will also be very extendable, and it will also come with the following applications.
[size=36pt]DigiEdit[/size] [center][IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/c7sp1.png[/img][/center] [center][size=8pt]DigiEdit v1.0alpha screenshot[/size][/center] [size=16pt]What is DigiEdit?[/size]
DigiEdit is the tile editor for DigiLife. DigiLife comes with the official tileset (or maps if you wish to call it) but will also be optimized for 3rd party maps. Server hosts will be able to host a server on an entirely different city of their own with DigiEdit maps.
DigiEdit first alpha version has been released, please download it here [url=http://downloads.digilifegame.com]http://downloads.digilifegame.com[/url] under the DigKit section. Remember to report any bugs on the forums under the DigiKit section.
[b]Major Features of DigiEdit v1.0 alpha:[/b]
[i]MultiLayered Tile Editor[/i] [center][IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/1zft1r4.png[/img][/center] [center][size=8pt]Multi-Layer options, they are, from left to right: Layer 1, Layer 2, Layer 3, Shadows and Layer Only View[/size][/center]
It is a multi-layered tile editor, which means that it supports editing tiles at different layers overlaying each other. This technique is used to get rid of extra hassle of base tiles. For example, there's a table, but the table has to stand on something, lets say... a wooden floor. But lets say the table moved, an NPC pushed it outside, then, without multi-layering, we'll need to paint the ground that the table stands on to 'grass'. Therefore we're using 4 layers, with the 1st layer being the base layer, where things like grass, wood, concrete and all other floor tiles are laid. On top of that we have furnitures and decorations, 3rd layer is further decorations and 4th layer is the shadow layer, where shadows are mapped out.
With Layered-Only view, the user can see exactly what tiles are on this layer. Therefore avoiding further confusion.
[i]Detailed Information[/i]
[center][IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/2vtr0g4.png[/img][/center]
Lots of information about the map is right at the bottom left corner of the editor. From map properties, comments to view linked chunks (which is currently not implemented).
[i]Tile templates[/i]
[center][IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/2rfskty.png[/img][/center]
Grab tiles on the go, right on the bottom right corner of the editor. Currently, only 5 tiles are implemented, but more will come as the game gets released.
[size=36pt]Planned Apps: [/size]
The following apps will be planned and implemented: [list] [li]DigiMart - A market tool that allows user to create custom items and prices[/li] [li]DigiAI - An AI tool for creating characters and entities[/li][/list] [li]DigiAssembler - A wrap up program that assembles entity, buildings and maps together to make a playable map. [/li][/ul]
[hr]
[size=18pt]Refer to the Game Forums if you have any questions :)[/size]
Brought to you by DeathJockey and others in JayPix Studios. Thank you :)
Game Website: [url=http://digilifegame.com]http://digilifegame.com[/url] Game Forums: [url=http://forums.digilifegame.com]http://forums.digilifegame.com[/url]

I’ve revamped DigiLife last week and here are some progress updates:

Note that they might be outdated, so for the latest updates, always check http://digilifegame.tk

WORLD PARSING NOW WORKS (Still in Development), DigiLife will now read and parse maps made by DigiKit, and here’s a screenshot to show (I know about the FPS, at the moment this ‘process’ is very early stage of development)

[center]

2zyda40.png1138×854
[/center]
[center]Map made in DigiKit[/center]

[center]

2i8e3c.png1138×904
[/center]
[center]Same map that is loaded in DigiLife[/center]

So yeah, I’m going to be doing alot of optimisation for this, to get the FPS back to 60 (which should be easy). I’ve also chucked in a login system for (maybe skins) but mainly some data to be used in-game from the DigiLife servers. The game login is your DigiLife website login.

Here’s a login screen test with me making a typo in my password :

[center]

xmu6c9.png1138×904
[/center]
[center]The login screen, removed background for seriousness :P[/center]

There’s a whole lot more, but they’re all minor changes & features so I decided not to show them. stay tuned for more updates as they are on their way

Everything is going very well at the moment and I just think I’d like someone with good experience in graphics to help with some art

[size=18pt]Innovation[/size]
I decided to re-innovate this game after seeing some movies on Game Development. I then reset the development of DigiLife (only the client, DigiKit etc. are still there). It has been 3 days since the reset and I’m already past my old milestone.

I’ve rewritten the game so that it’s better, more efficient and less resource hogging. I’m also going to announce some stuff below.

New Logo

Because its a new design, I made a new logo for it, I’m not the artist guy, so please, bare with me

[center][/center]

New Look

Yes, I did spend quite a bit of time retexturing the game, and this is what it looks like now:

12552ko.png1138×904

I’m now working on loading DigiKit worlds for DigiLife and then it’s entity work.

Open Source

There’s no point keeping it secure, people’s gonna decompile it anyways. Go here for the source code: http://github.com/deathjockey/digilife

Remember to check out the DigiLife website

Some early builds will be published soon, so check it out!
